review: Bottom line, would buy again. Setup was easy and quick. It had trouble initially connecting to wifi (though the device know it had a strong connection.) Had to call customer service and they had me factory reset which did not solve the problem. They offered to send a new one. I decided to try mine again another day and has worked since. Would recommend having it in the same room as the router, had to move mine even closer to prevent delays. Easy to operate, user friendly.

review: Pros: Smooth navigation with very intuitive interaction with the sleek remote. Offers a lot of content such as Netflix that's much easier to work with than Netflix off our Blu-ray player. Netflix comes off great. Cons: HBOGO is out-of-sync with its audio (audio is about a half-second ahead of the content) as it renders HBOGO unwatchable. I researched this and found that dozens of others have posted about this issue over the last few months in an Amazon forum (http://www.amazon.com/HBOGO-Audio-sync-Fire-stick/forum/Fx3THIQES502AOU/Tx3BBSA3JCR2T0P/1?_encoding=UTF8&asin;=B0089BPEZS) and many have posted that the solutions given to them are unsatisfactory. One solution was to turn off Dolby, which, even if it does work it defeats the purpose of HBOGO on the Fire Stick. I myself asked for help regarding this issue and Amazon only sent me a form email in response. I'm not confident I'll use the stick all that much if Amazon continues to ignore the problem.
author: Tom Oling
